intro: Gaertnera pangati, commonly known as the Tongan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Tonga. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with serrated edges. Gaertnera pangati thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
